Hopefully in Cyberpunk there's no stats that's tied with bullet damage - its just an unnecessary recipe for including bullet spongy enemies that an absurd amount of bullets etc. I abhor games with this mechanic... it just makes them look like a shitshow.Ôªø

I gotta be frank on this, relying completely on templates seems like a bit of a step back. Especially since other games like Fallout 3/New Vegas, Skyrim, and Dark Souls were able to use sliders and Fallout 4 had a full on sculpting feature. If they're presets to choose and then build off of, that would be a very different matter but when I heard that you could spend hours customizing your character, I was thinking the appearance would have a bit more depth to it. 

Of course there's all the other stuff. I do like being able to customize the character's backstory similar to Mass Effect. I do hope that's well fleshed out and offers a lot of interesting but diverse options for the sort of character one would want to play as. 

The clothing stuff seems alright. I do hope there's some good variation in clothing available. 

Concerning stats, I could have sworn that luck and empathy weren't stats in the video game. I believe Yong Yea said that.Ôªø
